business.headline: Indian airlines may face turbulence as Pakistan closes its skiesPakistan has announced shutting its airspace to Indian carriers as tensions rise between the two neighbours following a deadly militant attack in Indian Kashmir earlier this week.

Samsung to invest Rs 1,000 crore in Tamil Nadu plant: ReportSamsung's Tamil Nadu factory currently employs over 2,000 people. In 2022–23, the plant contributed one-fifth of Samsung's Rs 1 lakh crore sales in India.
Sensex, Nifty close lower as rising India-Pakistan tension spooks investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 588.80 points to end at 79,212.53, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 207.35 points to end at 24,039.35.

Pahalgam terror attack casts big shadow on Kashmir's booming tourism economyKashmir was slowly rebuilding its image as a peaceful tourist destination after years of conflict, especially after the abrogation of Article 370 in August 2019.

Sebi revises cut-off timings for overnight mutual fund redemptions. Details hereSebi aims to make sure stock brokers and clearing members use client funds wisely by investing in secure overnight mutual fund schemes (MFOS).

Air India may buy 10 Boeing planes turned down by China: ReportThe ongoing trade tensions between the US and China, marked by steep duties above 100%, have impacted various sectors, even the aviation industry has taken a hit.
Pakistan Stock Exchange portal crashes amid rising geopolitical heatThe online portal of PSX showed a message saying "We'll be back soon," indicating that the website was temporarily unavailable.

Bengaluru resident shares costly homebuying mistake: 'Don't fall for FOMO'A social media user from Bengaluru shared that he has been living in Bengaluru for the past six years. Like many others, he moved to the city for better career opportunities. Despite being financially stable, he chose to rent rather than buy a flat. But the trouble started soon after.

Sensex, Nifty tank: Indo-Pak tensions trigger market crash. Check top losersSensex plunged over 1,000 points, while Nifty tanked over 300 points, falling below 24,000 as uncertainty prevailed over geopolitical tensions.

Apple plans to make all US iPhones in India by 2026: ReportThe said move is part of Apple's long-term plan to reduce its dependence on China, especially after the recent tariff rules announced by US President Donald Trump.

Ather Energy IPO: Check latest GMP as Rs 3,000 crore public listing to open soonThe Ather Energy IPO will be a book-built issue. It consists of a fresh issue of 8.18 crore equity shares worth Rs 2,626 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 1.11 crore shares worth Rs 354.76 crore.

Sensex falls 1,000 points: Why is stock market falling today despite early gains?Sensex and Nifty plunged more than 1% reacting to uncertainty over geopolitical tensions. The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1,026.28 points to 78,775.15, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 330.40 points to 23,916.30 as of 11:41 am.

entertainment.headline: Pakistani actor Mahira Khan condemns Pahalgam attack, deletes post laterPakistani actor Mahira Khan expressed her grief over the Pahalgam terror attack on Instagram. However, she deleted the post later.

When Nana Patekar made a producer wash dishes after serving him muttonIn a candid revelation, Paresh Rawal shared an amusing incident involving Nana Patekar and a producer. The story highlighted how Nana made the producer wash dishes after treating him to mutton.

Nani's HIT 3 gets A certificate, film all set for May 1 releaseTelugu star Nani's 'HIT: The Third Case' has cleared censorship with an 'A' certificate. The film is gearing up for a grand release in theatres on May 1.

Vir Das wraps record-breaking Mind Fool world tour, thanks fansVir Das has wrapped up his historic Mind Fool world tour, acclaimed as the largest by an Indian comedian. The tour not only showcased his wit to a global audience but also set the stage for his upcoming projects.

Thudarum review: Mohanlal's crime drama is good mix of thrills and punchesReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025Thudarum film review: This crime drama, starring Mohanlal and Shobana, has been directed by Tharun Moorthy of Saudi Vellaka fame. Thudarum is an engaging film with a suspenseful storyline and some classic Mohanlal action.

Tahira Kashyap returns to work after cancer relapse: Picture abhi baaki haiTahira Kashyap, filmmaker and author, has returned to work after facing a breast cancer relapse. She shared this 'life update' on Instagram.

Ground Zero review: Emraan Hashmi elevates relevant story of Kashmir's silence, furyReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025Ground Zero movie review: The film is about a soldier's spirit, his idea of patriotism, and his search for peace in the 'highly sensitive' area. Emraan Hashmi brings a relevant film that comments on Kashmir's shifting skies wounded by terrorism.

Kapkapiii teaser: Shreyas Talpade leads the Hindi remake of RomanchamTusshar Kapoor and Shreyas Talpade star in 'Kapkapiii', a Hindi remake of the Malayalam horror-comedy Romancham. Directed by late Sangeeth Sivan, the film releases on May 23, 2025.

Superboys of Malegaon OTT release: When and where to watch Reema Kagti's filmReema Kagti and Varun Grover's 'Superboys of Malegaon' began streaming on Prime Video. It stars Adarsh Gourav, Vineet Kumar Singh, Shashank Arora, and Anuj Singh Duhan.

Sarkeet trailer: Asif Ali headlines powerful tale of friendship and heartbreakAsif Ali, Divya Prabha and Deepak Parambol have come together for the heartwarming story of 'Sarkeet'. The trailer of the film was released on Thursday.

MAD Square OTT release: When and where to watch Nithin, Ram, Sangeeth's comedy film'MAD Square', the sequel to the hit campus comedy 'MAD', has made its OTT debut, after a successful theatrical run. It hit theatres on March 29.

Actor Kim Soo-hyun's fans hire lawyer to defend him against online harassmentFans of 'Queen of Tears' actor Kim Soo-hyun have appointed a lawyer to tackle the rising online abuse against the actor. The move aims to counter malicious comments and protect his reputation.

Jewel Thief review: Nothing worth stealing in this diamond-sized disasterReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025Siddharth Anand's 'Jewel Thief: The Heist Begins' makes other mediocre heist dramas like 'Happy New Year' look like a masterpiece. The Saif Ali Khan and Jaideep Ahlawat-starrer is not even all style, no meat. It's worse than that.

Vikrant Massey to play Sri Sri Ravi Shankar in Siddharth Anand's upcoming thrillerVikrant Massey is set to portray spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar in Siddharth Anand's international thriller, 'White,' which delves into Shankar's pivotal role in resolving Colombia's long-standing civil war. The film is being directed by Montoo Bassi.

Tom Cruise's Mission Impossible Final Reckoning to release 6 days early in IndiaThe official Indian release date for Tom Cruise's highly anticipated 'Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning' is out. The film will hit Indian theatres six days before its official worldwide release.

Rajinikanth makes a quick stop at temple on his way to Jailer 2 shoot. WatchSupertstar Rajinikanth stopped his vehicle to visit a temple in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. The actor was on his way to the shooting location of his upcoming film, 'Jailer 2'.

Ground Zero X reviews: Fans call Emraan Hashmi film 'impactful and relevant'Emraan Hashmi's new film 'Ground Zero', has been well-received by audiences. Praised for its strong performances and relevant narrative, the movie addresses contemporary political issues with depth.

Parth Samthaan reacts to brutal trolling for replacing ACP Pradyuman in CID 2Actor Parth Samthaan reacted to the backlash after he replaced ACP Pradyuman in CID 2. He said he wasn't expecting to be trolled in the manner and revealed that his character

general news.headline: Indus water to Pakistan to be stopped, capacity of dams to be increased: SourcesIndus water to Pakistan to be stopped, capacity of dams to be increased: Government sources

Pony ride operator, who tourist claimed 'asked about religion', detained in J&KPahalgam terror attack: Police on Friday identified and detained a suspect after a video went viral on social media. Ekta Tiwari from Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur claimed that the suspect asked her about her religion.

Expel Pakistanis, Amit Shah directs states after India moves to cancel visasFollowing a high-level meeting with top officials, Union Home Minister Amit Shah instructed Chief Ministers of all states to take immediate steps to deport them, a day after India cancelled all existing visas for Pakistani nationals.

Been doing US's dirty work…: On live TV, Pak minister's big admission on terrorThe remark, a vindication of India's long-held stand, comes at a time when India has held Pakistan indirectly responsible for the terror attack in Pahalgam.

Amid tensions with Pakistan, what does India's 'Aakraman' exercise indicate?India's frontline fighter jets and IAF's top pilots took part in a large-scale military exercise amid heightened tensions with Pakistan. History has ample proof to show that such exercises have preceded conflicts.

When India gave Pakistan war scare with 5 lakh troops on borderIn the winter of 1986-1987, India rolled out tanks and troops on a scale not seen in peacetime since World War II. India's Operation Brasstacks stunned Pakistan and made it scramble its military resources and reveal it had nuclear capability. As tensions soar after the Pahalgam massacre, here's a look at the India-Pakistan war that never was.

As Pak sweats over India action, its citizens have a field day mocking themselvesAs India announced a raft of punitive measures against Pakistan, it seems that instead of losing sleep over the outcome, Pakistani citizens have taken to trolling themselves.

Stop Wagah ceremony, it's not military parade but clownery, say some IndiansThe Border Security Force (BSF) has "scaled down" the Retreat Ceremony, popularly referred to as Beating Retreat, at the Attari-Wagah border after the Pahalgam terror attack. Some Indians are now demanding that the ceremony be stopped altogether, calling it "cringe showmanship" and "clownery".

How Pakistan's airspace ban will affect your international travelAs political tensions escalate between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack, Islamabad has closed its airspace to Indian carriers. Indian travellers planning an international trip should brace for turbulence - not just in the sky, but in their wallets and travel plans as well.

Pak flag missing from Himachal Raj Bhavan's table on which Simla Accord was signedA day after Pakistan suspended the Simla Agreement of 1972 in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack, the Pakistani flag on the historic table at the Raj Bhavan in Shimla, on which the pact was signed, went missing.

Pahalgam attack: Octroi Post closed for civilians after India, Pak shut borderThe India-Pakistan border at Octroi Post in Jammu and Kashmir's RS Pura sector has been closed to civilian visitors in response to the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people.

In Pahalgam attack, one Aadil caused bloodshed, another Adil took bulletsIn the Pahalgam terror attack, which claimed 26 lives, two Adils have come to the forefront. One opened fire on a group of tourists in the Baisaran meadow, while another sacrificed his life trying to save tourists and took three bullets in his chest.

Misleading narrative built on 'waqf by user': Centre defends law in Supreme CourtThe Centre argued that even if all waqfs, including 'waqf by user', had to be mandatorily registered under the original act of 1923, several private and government lands were claimed under 'waqf by user', leading to deprivation of valuable property rights of individuals and unauthorised claims over public properties.

Top court scolds Rahul Gandhi over Savarkar remark: Your grandmother praised himThe Supreme Court on Thursday came down heavily on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his alleged objectionable remarks against freedom fighter Veer Savarkar, saying that the court won't allow such comments against freedom fighters and warning of suo motu action if repeated.

J&K attack: Did intel about movements of LeT terrorists in Pahalgam go unnoticed?Pahalgam terror attack: India Today has learnt that intelligence input had warned of a Pakistan-based terror outfit instructing its local operatives to scout hotels in Pahalgam, where 26 people were killed in a terror attack.

BJP's Raja Iqbal Singh is Delhi's new Mayor, Congress candidate gets just 8 votesDelhi reclaimed control of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi after a two-year gap, as party candidate Raja Iqbal Singh was elected Mayor of Delhi, securing 133 out of 142 votes.

Phule review: Pratik-Patralekhaa's revolutionary film dimmed by dull storytellingReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025'Phule' movie review: Director Ananth Mahadevan's 'Phule' delves into the lives of social reformers Jyotirao Phule and Savitribai Phule and their fight for women's education and caste discrimination. Despite its historical significance, the film struggles to engage the audience.

India not to provide water to Pak under Indus Waters Treaty, say sourcesPahalgam terror attack live updates: A crucial meeting on the Indus Water Treaty issue will be held today at the residence of Home Minister Amit Shah. Several Union Ministers, including Jal Shakti Minister CR Patil, are expected to attend the meeting. On Tuesday, 26 people were killed in a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam. Following the attack, India took a series of sweeping diplomatic and strategic countermeasures against Pakistan, including the effective downgrading of diplomatic relations with Pakistan, closure of key border routes, suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, and the expulsion of Pakistani military attaches from its High Commission in New Delhi. Follow indiatoday.in for more updates.

Here are 8 kinetic options India can choose from to avenge PahalgamThe Pahalgam attack marked a turning point. With diplomatic heat rising and military options on the table, India is weighing its response to ensure Pakistan never repeats such a strike.

Top LeT commander Altaf Lalli killed in gunfight in J&K's BandiporaOn Friday morning, acting on specific intelligence about the presence of terrorists, a joint search operation was launched by the Indian Army and Jammu and Kashmir Police in Bandipora. Contact was established with the terrorists, leading to a firefight.

Mini celebrities, major consequences: The dark side of child stardom onlineThe term 'kidfluencer' refers to children under 13 who command large audiences on platforms like Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok.

NBA: Ja Morant exits with hip injury, Grizzlies collapse in Game 3 loss to ThunderMemphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant suffered a left hip injury during Game 3 of the 2025 NBA playoffs after a mid-air collision with the Oklahoma City Thunder's Lu Dort late in the second quarter.

Josh Hazlewood praises 'genius' Jitesh Sharma for game-changing DRS call vs RRRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) seamer Josh Hazlewood has praised Jitesh Sharma for his match-changing DRS call against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in Match 42 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

NFL Draft: Cam Ward goes No. 1 to Titans as Travis Hunter shocks NFL draft with Jaguars tradeThe Tennessee Titans have selected Miami quarterback Cam Ward with the No. 1 overall pick in the 2025 NFL Draft, solidifying their search for a franchise quarterback.

Cummins hoping for batters to stand up, as SRH aim late comeback in IPLSunRisers Hyderabad captain Pat Cummins believes that the team can score big runs even if one or two more batters stand up in their matches in the IPL. Cummins' SRH are tottering at the bottom two spots of the league table.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
